data.title: Loganair Limited
data.meta_description:
Loganair Limited | 21,148 followers on LinkedIn. Your Journey. Our Joy.  | Loganair Limited has been in continuous operation for more than 60 years.  We deliver an established network of scheduled flights around the United Kingdom, Norway, Denmark, Ireland, and the Isle of Man. 

Our employees are based around the network and operate Embraer 145, ATR 42-500, ATR 72-600, Twin Otter and BN2 Islander aircraft types.
data.text:
Loganair is delighted to announce the appointment of Natalie Bush as Chief Operating Officer (COO) and Accountable Manager. Natalie, who is currently the UK Director and Accountable Manager for TUI Airways, will join as part of our Executive Committee in December 2024, and will report to CEO, Luke Farajallah. She will also be joining the Board Safety Review Committee, reporting directly to the Loganair Chairman James Drummond on matters relating to airline safety and safety culture. Natalie has had an impressive career to date, which commenced with several years in the Royal Navy as a Warfare officer, before she joined Flybe as a pilot, initially flying the BAE146, and the Embraer 195. Her flying career progressed to see her achieve a command on the Q400 fleet at the same time as taking on management roles, ultimately leading to being appointed as Director of Safety and Security for the airline until 2019, when she left to join Specialist Aviation Services (now Gama Aviation) as COO. Following a successful time in the rotary sector delivering helicopter and maintenance services to the UK air ambulance industry, she then returned to the airline sector with TUI Airways. Natalie will assume leadership for all operational and service delivery areas including the pilot, cabin crew and airport workforce groups across Loganair. She will also be responsible for ground handling, safety, security, and compliance, as well as for the network operations teams. She will additionally lead industrial relations across the front-line areas. Luke Farajallah, CEO, Loganair, said: “We are extremely happy to have been able to attract one of the most talented rising stars of the aviation sector, whose career is going from strength to strength, to the UK’s largest regional airline. Natalie makes a huge impact wherever she goes, and she thoroughly deserves this important and exciting leadership opportunity at Loganair. We are looking forward to her arrival later this year.”

We are delighted to announce the appointment of Stuart Duncan as our new Director of Legal, reporting to CFO Chris Gemmell, as part of the Leadership Team. Stuart joined us on August 1st, and will split his working time between our offices in Glasgow and Aberdeen, acting as internal legal counsel, providing comprehensive guidance across various aspects of our operation, and assisting the business to increase and improve its understanding and competence of all things legal. Stuart brings a broad background of experience following his qualification as a solicitor in 1998. He started his career in Glasgow as a commercial property lawyer in private practice, before moving in-house for a ten-year stint as head of legal for a UK-listed property investment company. He and his family then moved back to his roots in Aberdeen, where he joined Bond Offshore Helicopters with responsibility for supporting all aspects of the operation during a period of significant growth and transition. Having a particular focus on commercial contracts, this led to him developing a strong working relationship with Loganair over the last few years. Stuart’s appointment heralds a new phase of exciting changes to the Loganair leadership, with further announcements expected in the coming days and weeks.

We are thrilled to announce that Loganair will be the official Airline Partner of the Orkney2025 Island Games! ✈️🤝 This will be the biggest event Orkney has ever hosted, marking the 40th anniversary of the Games. Next July, Orkney will welcome over 24 island groups competing in 12 sports, making it one of the largest multisport events in Europe. 🏅 Hosting such a landmark event is a tremendous honour for Orkney. Loganair is incredibly proud to partner and play a role in bringing the Island Games to the Orkney Islands, sharing Orkney's rich culture and warm hospitality with visitors from across the globe. 🌎🫶 Flights will go on sale starting next week. The countdown is now on.. ⌛

Celebrations all around in the skies! 🎂✈️ Last week, we celebrated carrying over 1.5 MILLON customers through Glasgow Airport. For the Lee Family, who brought us over the milestone, it wasn't the only thing to celebrate.🎊 Laura, Stan, and their enthusiastic 3-year-old, Iver – were returning home to Benbecula from Glasgow after celebrating Laura and Iver's birthdays with relatives in Lincolnshire. This milestone marks a massive achievement for Loganair at Glasgow Airport, one of our key bases. Our regular service to the Scottish Islands provides an essential connection for the rural communities we proudly serve. Time really flies when you are having fun. 🫶 Pictured (L-R): Mark Beveridge (Managing Director at Glasgow Airport), Laura Lee, Iver Lee, Stan Lee and Luke Lovegrove (Chief Commercial Officer at Loganair).

We are thrilled to announce that we've hit a significant fundraising milestone for our amazing charity partner, Children's Hospices Across Scotland (CHAS) with a total of £35,000! 🎉 The money so far has been raised by our amazing colleagues, who have volunteered to raise funds or hosted special events. But we're not stopping there! We're taking our commitment to the next level and giving you easy ways to get involved, too - with an optional £2 donation now available to purchase when making bookings at Loganair.co.uk. With over a million customers every year, every £2 counts - together, we can ensure no family in Scotland faces the loss of a child alone. Thank you. 🙌 Pictured (L-R): Rami Okasha (Chief Executive Officer at CHAS) and Luke Farajallah (Chief Executive Officer at Loganair)

Another milestone unlocked! 🎖️ Did you know we have now carried over 1.5 MILLION customers through Aberdeen International Airport? 🛫 We celebrated the moment with Rhys and Zoe and their two children, Owen and Nia, as they helped us cross the threshold. 🎉 En route to visit family in Manchester, the young family were surprised with complimentary flights, which they plan to use for another family visit later this year! It was extra special considering the airport is entering its 90th year of operations, and we're delighted to have been part of it! 🎂 Pictured L-R: Fiona MacLeod (Director of Charter Services at Loganair), Owen Jones, Rhys Jones, Zoe and Nia Jones, Robert Paterson (Head of Operations at Aberdeen International Airport)
